fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5186].
  {panel}

The idea behind space channels is relatively simple in terms of concept, but probably quite a lot of work in terms of implementation.

Labels allow us to easily tag content, effectively categorising it. However, it seems there is still one component missing that would tie up lots of loose ends such as:

* Namespaces
* Spaces within spaces (eg. for dealing with permissions across blocks of content in a space)
* Permissions (see above)
* etc.

NOTE: I know that what follows could essentially be done with multiple spaces, however there are many times when it's not practical or desirable to do so, hence the channels idea.

The channels idea works as follows:

1. A space admin can create one or more channels (there would likely be a default channel for all content).

2. For each channel, the space admin can select what privileges are assigned to groups/users/anon for that channel - eg. who can edit content in that channel.

3. Ideally, the space admin should also be able to define what macros/templates can be used within a channel. Being able to have an email archive per channel would also be highly useful.

A default channel would be used to deal with old content - eg. when you upgrade to the version of Confluence that has channels, everything gets put in to the default channel for each space (pages, templates, mail archive, space permissions). Due to this default channel, you'd instantly then be able to define what macros can be used in a space.

Now, let's say you want a team (user group) to be able to edit one section of a space and not another - simply create a new channel and assign the privs, etc.

Pages would then have a channel drop-down (a page can only be in one channel).  You would obviously need a "Change channel" permission somewhere. Any pages created that are attached to a parent page would automatically inherit the parent page's channel - for most users (who cannot "change channel") they would be none the wiser as the option would not be available (the applicable channel would merely be displayed as text) = keeps things simple for them.  So, from an editing point of view, there's not too much work involved.

You would not be able to move pages outside of a given channel - someone with "change channel" priv would have to do that for you = nice container allowing orgnaisations to contain content for a given channel within that channel.

As mentioned earlier, each channel could have it's own mail archive and templates.  The mail archive is particularly interesting as you would then have the ability for teams to work side by side in a space, each with their own archive.

Templates should be able to be in all channels, one channel or several channels - eg. if you want to share a common template with all channels in a space.

You could search by channel.  You could export a channel (eg. to Word = great for documentation, etc). You could get an RSS feed for the channel.

Being able to set permissions and what macros can be used in a channel means that different groups with different experience and privileges/needs can be more effectively "boxed in" within a space.

Comments?
fields.summary: Space Channels - insane idea or inspired idea?

fields.description:
1. Create a new page
2. Edit the page and paste this into the wiki markup tab
{html}
<iframe src='http://wiki.riptown.com/applications/ResourceLocator/Seymour10.svg' height='674' width='1124' FRAMEBORDER=0 NOBORDER />
{html}
3.  click save
4. click the edit tab
5. look at what it has on the rich text editor
6. click on the wiki markup tab
7. look at what it has on this tab

Its now impossible to edit the page properly. The only workaround I found was to set the Wiki Markup tab as the users default, that way when you click the edit tab the wysisyg editor doesn't screw up the html macro before you can edit it.
fields.summary: Swicthing between Rich Text and Wiki Markup loses content between {html} macro tags

fields.description:
I'm running  safari 1.3.1(v312.3.3) on mac os X 10.3.9 

First I click "edit" on a page in confluence, and go to the wiki markup page.  Then, while I'm in the wiki markup page, I type ctrl-a, which normally would move the cursor to the beginning of the line.  Instead I get a popup window which says: "Invalid reply from server".

If I type <command>-<left arrow>, which is another keystroke combination to move the cursor to the begining of the line, that works fine.  So there is a workaround.  If I type ctrl-e the cursor moves to the end of the line, as expected.
fields.summary: safari error on wiki-markup screen when I hit ctrl-a

fields.description:
Many of my users are complaining about one little issue in Confluence. 
When you do a search you get a set of results.  You then click on a result....its not the page you want and so you press the back button to go back to the search results.....your then get a popup with the browser winging about something to do with posting forms (most users don't understand the message anyway).   Users are very accustomed to the google approach to searching i.e you keep going back to the search page.  This is in my opinion a major useability issue.  Whilst I am a big Confluence fan, I'm just getting so many of the website users complaining about this.
fields.summary: Back button (when going back to search page) give frustrating popup.

fields.description:
When I add certain permissions to some users in Confluence ands Jira, I'd like to test those by login as those users and check that all permissions are correct and all required pages are accessible and all pages that should be restricted are not accessible.

I'dlike to be able to do it without knowing or resetting user's password.
fields.summary: Allow admin to be able to login under another user name

fields.description:
To help us identify which license key a customer is renewing or upgrading, we want to display a License ID (a unique identifier of sorts) on the admin License Details page, which the customer can then quote when ordering their renewal.

The current thinking is that we'll use the first 10 characters of the license key as the License ID.
fields.summary: Add License ID to View License Page

fields.description:
We can no longer assume that our in memory id generator will provide the correct results. 

a) move to the hilo generator.
b) ensure that no SQL statements / comparators rely upon the id being sequential to handle the ordering of entities.
fields.summary: Change object id generation to be cluster friendly.

fields.description:
If a page is trashed, the user who performed it should be recorded, as well as the time.

Perhaps this could be extended to restoration as well?
fields.summary: Record the user and timestamp when a page is trashed
Ability to view pages in trash

fields.description: When searching for a user (e.g. page permissions), the Velocity variables are rendered to the screen, instead of the actual values. Tom tells me this is because when you search for a group, the username is returned, rather than a User object, so calling $user.name on the username doesn't work.
fields.summary: SearchEntitiesAction displays $user.name, $user.fullName, $user.email instead of the proper values when searching for a group

fields.description: On Firefox and windows, ctrl-Z undoes (e.g. styling a heading), but Firefox on OS X doesn't
fields.summary: Firefox on OS X -- Command-Z doesn't undo in Wysiwyg

fields.description:
So links like http://kb.mozillazine.org/Links_to_local_pages_don't_work don't render correctly.

See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+to+local+file+under+Firefox
fields.summary: Links with an apostrophe fails to render

fields.description:
It would be great if there would be a way to have a table forms editor added to the tool.  We use confluence for all of our internal documentation and several areas are managed in table form.  In many cases one person prepares a page where then a larger set of people start filling in information.  It's very difficult to manage a table which has a lot of formatting in it and then later someone needs to add information to it.  

We currently use an excel template which will add pipes (|) between each column so that it then can be copied and pasted to confluence.  Once there we will fill in information.  I would like to see something like a "Form Edit" button where instead of the current "Edit" the Form Edit view would show the page as a fillable form based on formatting.

Here is an example of a table we use:

||Cycle||Start||End||Planned Tasks ||Done Tasks ||Comment ||Mgr Review Comments |
||{panel:borderStyle=none|bgColor=Silver}{color:black}*3 Silver*{color}{panel}|12/30/2005|1/12/2006|     |     |     |     |
||{panel:borderStyle=none|bgColor=Gold}{color:black}*5 Gold*{color}{panel}|1/13/2006|1/26/2006| |     |     |     |
||    {panel:borderStyle=none    |    bgColor=Orange}{color:black}*7 Orange*{color}{panel}    |    1/27/2006    |    2/9/2006    |     |     |     |     |
||    {panel:borderStyle=none    |    bgColor=Red}{color:black}*9 Red*{color}{panel}    |    2/10/2006    |    2/23/2006    |     |     |     |     |
||    {panel:borderStyle=none    |    bgColor=Turquoise}{color:black}*11 Turquoise*{color}{panel}    |    2/24/2006    |    3/9/2006    |     |     |     |     |
||    {panel:borderStyle=none    |    bgColor=Blue}{color:black}*13 Blue*{color}{panel}    |    3/10/2006    |    3/23/2006    |     |     |     |     |
||    {panel:borderStyle=none    |    bgColor=#A2C257}{color:black}*15 Avocado*{color}{panel}    |    3/24/2006    |    4/6/2006    |     |     |     |     |
||    {panel:borderStyle=none    |    bgColor=Lime}{color:black}*17 Lime*{color}{panel}    |

fields.description:
I have this problem using IE (6.0) and no issue using Firefox (1.5).

Everytime I try to export a page as a word document IE prompts the attached message.

If I save the document as proposed (exportword.action) then rename with a .doc extension, it is the expected and well formed word document.

Pdf export works well.
fields.summary: Export a page as a word document opens exportword.action in IE instead of pagename.doc
support team labels in the rss feed builder

fields.description: tried to upload a file to confluence.atlassian.com and it was bigger than 1mb, browser had an error. When I shrunk to file it worked ok
fields.summary: uploading a file larger than the max size gives a browser error

fields.description:
When you edit a page with Safari, any draft will munge high-bit characters. It looks like multi-byte chars are being converted into single-byte characters somehow. This is annoying.

Does not affect other browsers, and only affects Safari in pages that are saved as a draft, then restored from draft.
fields.summary: Draft saving incorrectly encodes characters in Safari
Confirm page for restoration of spaces/site from backup

fields.description: You can paste an image into the wysiwyg editor, and there is no reason why the HTML produced couldn't be parsed into a link. This would avoid the need to use the insert image dialog. In fact the URL pasted could be retrieved and attached to the page...
fields.summary: Allow direct pasting of images into wysiwyg

fields.description: and then update bucket and atlassian-user to use this cache interface.
fields.summary: move bucket cache manager into its own package

fields.description: We just upgraded to 2.1.1 Enterprise and we are experiencing an issue with Space Admin > Permissions > Edit Permissions > Select Users (which is the magnifying glass search feature).  Unless a user is in the "confluence-administrators" group they are unable to use this search function.  We need all confluence users to be able to use this feature.  I see that is calls on the function /admin/users/searchusers_userpicker.action, is this setup to be admin only by default?  If we can't allow other users to use this function can we remove the magnifying glass?
fields.summary: User picker in Edit Space Permissions page is only accessible by super users

fields.description:
Obviously the colon is a special character in the Lucene search syntax, but can we handle it better? For instance, search for 'javax.mail.NoSuchProviderException: smtp' and nothing is returned, search for 'javax.mail.NoSuchProviderException smtp' and you get a lot of valuable information.

I don't think we can expect users to know the difference. Can we strip colons from the end of words which are not recognised field names?

Please note that this issue can only be reproduced on full search. If searching for a page title with a colon in it using quick search the page title is found.
fields.summary: Colons and other special characters (exlamation-marks, question-marks, etc) break searches

fields.description:
When calling confluence1.storePage with a test page with only a few characters as content (e.g., "just a test"), the page was updated correctly.  However, when calling the same function on the same page with content of around 43 KB, the program runs for a long time until it received a response: "read timeout" from Confluence XML-RPC server.  At the same time in catalina.out, error was thrown: "2006-01-11 15:25:13,376 ERROR [confluence.rpc.xmlrpc.XmlRpcServer] service javax.servlet.ServletException: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: unexpected end of file found" Presumably due to the timeout.

Surprisingly, on another installation of 2.1.1 with exactly the same setting, the update of page works even for long content.  I'm puzzled by it, would you please check on it?  Thanks!
fields.summary: XML-RPC "read timeout" when updating pages with long contents

fields.description:
See CSP-2113 for an history of the issue on your support system.

We just started using confluence in production and I had once an annoying message regarding foreign key errors:

2005-12-28 17:45:55,735 ERROR [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaExport] Unsuccessful: alter table os_user_group add constraint FK932472461E2E76DB foreign key (group_id) references os_group (id)
2005-12-28 17:45:55,735 ERROR [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaExport] General error message from server: "Can't create table '.\conf\#sql-a30_a.frm' (errno: 150)"
[...] others (see attachment)

I was using mysql 4.0 so I thought it was a DB problem. I have just installed 4.1.16 and created a few pages (20 with 2 attachments). I did not have any foreign key errors this time. I then backuped, cleaned everything and tried to restor from backup and I still have those foreing key errors.

It means that I cannot use confluence in production at the moment because I will be unable to restore from it if I have any problem.

Using the PDF generation functionality for a page (e.g. click on the upper right on the PDF sign) the generated PDF doesn't contain pictures displayed on the page when:
a) the pictures are displayed as thumbnails
b) the pictures are not attached to the related page itself but in our case attached to other pages in the same space.
We are using this references often in our space to avoide redundancies and the update-problem!

So, unfortunately non of the Confluence export-functinalities is at the moment usable for us because the Word-export can't handle the German Umlaute, uaahh .. help!.
fields.summary: Html Export doens't include images when the image isn't stored within the page itself

fields.description:
There is a slight issue with searching in that if you search for a part of a word and apply a wildcard, Lucene doesn't find the word you intended.

e.g. if you search for "Management" (no quotes) on CAC, it returns a bunch of results. A search for "Managemen*", however, only returns one.

The reason for this is that "Managemen" is not a real English word, and so is not stemmed. So, the query term does not match the stemmed version of "management", "manag" that we have in the index, and the correct results aren't returned. (Note: the attachment returned by the wildcard query is due to the indexing of the full filename, which then matches "managemen*")

A solution to this may be to store the original word (as well as the stemmed) in a different field in the index. When a wildcard search term comes through, search the full and stemmed words. The cache may be bigger, and there may be a slight performance hit, but it will make searching a bit more reliable in these edge cases.
fields.summary: Stemming and wildcards do not play nicely in search queries

fields.description:
Some users have noted that it stalls on this line in the logs: 

2005-12-20 09:35:49,187 INFO [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AdditionalIndexes1UpgradeTask ] createIndex Creating index:create index cl_lastmoddate_idx on CONTENT_LABEL (LASTMODDATE)
fields.summary: Upgrade stalls on AdditionalIndexes1UpgradeTask
Add the "Full screen" option to the Wiki markup editor

fields.description:
I really like the concept of the full screen mode because it is so hard to deal with the double scroll bars when editing. However, this mode is almost completely unusable for us because the "Insert/Edit Link" button doesn't seem to work. I've tried in both Firefox 1.5 and in IE 6.0 and get the same problem.

To reproduce:
1. Edit any page
2. Click on the full screen icon
3. Click on the "Insert/Edit Link" icon
4. Search for a page
5. Click on that page
6. Press OK

You should see that the dialog appears to just ignore the OK button and doesn't go away. Canceling it does work but the page you chose does not get linked.

This is a major problem because there is no other way to create links in the rich text editor.
fields.summary: "Insert/Edit Link" button doesn't work in "Full screen" mode
Extend jiraissues macro to allow an explicit list of issues

fields.description:
I really love the power of labels and the 'contentbylabel' macro in Confluence 2.x, but I'm finding that the macro is a little underpowered when compared with the similar 'children' macro. Since both macros allow you to present a collection of pages they really should have the same core options.

The options I'm missing at the moment are:
1. The ability to sort the items
2. The ability to show excerpts
3. The ability to change the style

I'd also really like an option to be able to exclude the space name at the end for situations where I know that every item will be in the same space. See this page for an example:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Frequently+Asked+Questions

It is possible that some of these options are available but undocumented, but it is difficult to tell.
fields.summary: Add more options to contentbylabel macro

fields.description:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Release+Notes+2.1.1

and click "View in Hierarchy" (http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/listpages-dirview.action?key=DOC&openId=149718#selectedPageInHierarchy) a NullPointerException is thrown with the following message:

Invocation of method 'generateCollapseNodeLinkForNonJSUsers' in  class com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.DirectoryViewListPagesAction threw exception class java.lang.NullPointerException : null
fields.summary: NullPointerException when clicking "View in Hierarchy" on certain pages

fields.description:
Will need two parts:

1) Extractor plugin that does a getAncestors() on each page and stores the IDs of those pages in an ancestors field in Lucene
2) Macro / search enhancement to add +(ancestor:11223344) to a search
fields.summary: Ability to search part of the page tree

fields.description: Currently the blog post Macro seems to order the content by most recent updated.   It would be good to have the option to order by created date only.  That way a blog post that is very old will not jump to the top of the list when it is updated (e.g. when a page it links to has its name changed the news item is automatically updated and jumps to the top of the list.)
fields.summary: Blogpost macro - order by created date only

fields.description: If a user tries to edit or view a page that contains a macro which has thrown an exception (a common occurrence after some upgrades or among less stable macros), they receive a unhandled exception error and have no method to go back and edit the page to remove the macro, or even to delete the page.  Otherwise, it appears to me an administrator has to go in and disable the macros used (which is not always easy to tell which ones were without being able to edit the source).  Some functionality to address this is would be extremely valuable.  For instance, an option on the page where the exception occurs to turn off macros for that page, which could be re-enabled later.
fields.summary: Add "disable macros on this page" functionality to handle exceptions with macros

fields.description:
We and our customer switched to Confluence and we want now migrate our existing JSPWikis (270 & 540 pages) to Confluence. But now we figured out major problems with the export/import mechanism of Confluence (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Wiki+Importer): Especially we have big troubles to get our links to internal (pages and attachements) as well as external links correct into Confluence. Currently we have a state that makes it impossible to perform the migration to Confluence (both enterprise versions) :-(

Following some issues I've noticed during a test run:
1.) During the migration of attachements the file-names are loosing all their '-' characters with the result that all attachment-links brakes.

2.) The import also reases all '-' characters in imported links (URLs; in this case external links). For instance a link to 'http://www.'mgm-edv.de' will become 'http://www.'mgmedv.de'! --> a lot of broken links!

3.) Blanks in attachement file-names will also lead to broken attachement links in the pages.

4.) Has the attachment link in JSP-Wiki an alias like a filename.ext (e.g. [readme.doc|^readme_all_the_time.doc]) then this results also in malformed links --> [^readme.doc|readme_all_the_time.doc].
fields.summary: Wiki-Importer for JSPWiki has major problems with link-names and attachement-file-names

fields.description:
I've been experimenting with building an FAQ in Confluence and I've been really happy with how easy it was to do. As an example I started a Confluence community FAQ here:

  http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=151114

I'm now trying to work out how I could add a search box to each page that will search just within that section of the FAQ. I realize that there are a number of special search keywords that could be used to achieve this, but I would like a solution that doesn't require a user to realize that they are in Confluence. This isn't so important for the community FAQ, but I would like to provide this functionality on my company's support site where the users will just expect the search box to work.

Since my FAQ is built using labels, I figure that a very simple option would be to provide a new macro that would do the heavy lifting for me. Something like:

  {searchbox:labels=faq_general,faq_gettingstarted}

would provide a search box that would automatically filter the results to show content with one or other of the specified labels.

Another possibility which might work for me would be to provide a search box that would filter the results to only include children (or grandchildren etc) of the current page. This seems like it could be useful for a variety of situations where a section of a site is logically self contained. Clearly this could be solved today by making the section into its own space, but that causes different headaches.

Finally, if this power is available to this macro then it would also be great to expose these search options on the basic search page.  In fact, if the macro is a larger project then a good first step would be to make the basic search box allow you to refine your search once you'd done it. So on the search results page show a 'show only results beneath this page' check box and also provide  a  'show results only for pages with the following labels' component.

Sorry for proposing several features in one issue, but I didn't want to make this into multiple issues because it isn't clear to me what is the best design. I'll leave that to you guys... just treat my suggestions as fodder for brainstorming.
fields.summary: Provide ability to search within only part of a space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5108].
  {panel}

Currently, the only way to setup Confluence is either to:

1) Run through the web-based setup
2) Manually generate a valid confluence home directory

The second is complicated by the fact that you can't plonk a license into confluence.cfg.xml and expect it to work.

Dan Hardiker in an email:

> Ideally I would like to be able to replace the setup script with an automated version. Having it pull from a file put in a 
> system property (e.g. -Dconfluence.setup.config=/path/to/confluence-setup.properties) with the ability to set a URL 
> to navigate to once setup has completed would enable us to leave confluence to set itself up automatically, and then 
> have it directed to our xwork plugin to deal with setting up anything custom.

Maybe instead of a system property (which can cause problems if you forget to remove it next time you start up, have Confluence check if the confluence-home directory is (a) without a confluence-cfg.xml, and (b) contains a setup.properties file. If so, do the setup from setup.properties and then delete the properties file.
fields.summary: Non-interactive setup

fields.description:
4. In "Manage Users" fullname is incorrectly displayed sometimes..
>  > >
>  > > Often, instead of displaying the Full Name after a search in "Manage
>  > > Users" I see "$webwork.htmlEncode($user.fullName) " instead. This
>  > > occurs if EITHER the sn or the givenname field are blank.
>  > >
>  > > Fix: Could you allow firstnameAttribute OR surnameAttribute to be
>  > > blank.. If both are blank then maybe drop the result as invalid? Or at
>  > > least display a more friendly "No username available" message.
>  > >
>  > > Addendum: My internal "admin" user is giving the
>  > > "$webwork.htmlEncode($user.fullName)" message as well even though it
>  > > is stored in the Hibernate db. This appears to be because "admin"
>  > > exists as a user as well in LDAP. If I create a local account called
>  > > "admin-confluence" then fullname is displayed just fine.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5095].
{panel}
Edit restrictions are not inherited. 
 When we have a big existing space and we want to change edit permissions of a hierarchy, it's very painfull because we have to change manually the permissions of every pages of this hierarchy.
 We should be able to optionally inherit 'edit' permissions so as to 'view' permissions does.

In fact, I don't really understand why you do it for 'view' permissions and not for 'edit' permissions.

 
{panel:title=Atlassian Update, June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6554c0|titleBGColor=#6554c0|bgColor=#eae6ff|titleColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone

First of all, apologies for the time between updates and thank you for the ideas and feedback you have provided in these comments. It’s always helpful to understand how you work and how we can improve Confluence to better facilitate that. We have decided to close this issue as we won’t be addressing it in the foreseeable future. I wanted to take the opportunity to explain why.

Atlassian’s products are founded on encouraging open ways of working for all of our customers, and that influences many of the decisions we make about individual product features. Depending on the way that your teams work, you may find that this “open” model does not suit and we have seen that reflected in several feature requests.

This request has been open for nearly as long as Confluence has existed, and has been looked at by many Atlassians over the years. More recently, we planned and explored ways to resolve this and other permission-related challenges through research and design work. We took these opportunities to speak with a number of customers to validate use cases and ideas.

That brought us to a series of conclusions. Information often has a specific audience, and Confluence provides granular permissions controls, so that the right people can see the right content. This can get complicated, as it may include modifications to site and space level permissions, and/or page level restrictions that can be applied at a parent or child page level.

Changing Confluence’s model to offer edit permissions inheritance (in the same way view permissions are inherited) wasn’t the right way to address these needs:
 * Some customers rely on the way restrictions currently exist to lock down top-level pages and allow child pages to be open; we didn’t want to adversely affect those that need to have Confluence work this way.
 * Providing an option and explaining the ramifications of view/edit restriction decisions in a single dialog box is challenging, particularly when permissions are also in play. Over the last year we have made material progress on improving transparency of permissions, but that also served to demonstrate the complexity of messaging needed for possible different scenarios.
 * Through multiple rounds of design and customer feedback, there wasn’t a solution that passed our high quality bar for setting restrictions that allowed users to quickly and easily make decisions and understand the impact of them.

That said, we have considered multiple other approaches. Each of these has had significant development estimates, and these types of changes are continually prioritised against other improvements on the basis of which would provide more value to more customers.

As a result of this process, in [Confluence Server and Data Center 7.3|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-7-3-release-notes-983794557.html] we released a number of key features which addressed multiple other permission issues and requests which affect a large proportion of our customers; making it clearer who is able to view a page (Confluence Server and Data Center) and enabling admins to troubleshoot permission issues (Confluence Data Center). I know that you may find this disappointing and small consolation, given we’ve not met your specific request.

In the interests of being open, I wanted to provide this lengthier update and give you some clarity on this issue. Please know that we do read and listen to your feedback, even if we are not able to address the comments on issues. This is one of many channels that we have and take into consideration when determining our roadmap and we always appreciate your feedback.

Thanks

Makisa | Senior Product Manager, Confluence Server and Data Center
{panel}

fields.description: As administrators, sometimes we create pages that should be viewable by only certain user groups.  However, the restrict View/Edit in V2.1.1 allows only restriction to "myself" or the groups that the administrator belong to.  The problem is, it does not make sense to disallow administrators permission to assign a page to some group the administrators do not explicitly belong to.  When we have over 20 user groups and counting, it is not practical to add administrators to each group to make this work.
fields.summary: Administrators cannot restrict View/Edit of a page to a group that the administrator does not belong

fields.description: When I tried to search for a user in the "manage user" in adminstration, I couldn't find anything unless I typed in the entire username or Full Name or email address EXACTLY the way user entered.  This doesn't make sense since I frequently do not know the full name of a user or the full email address and the case user used to enter the email address.  The filters in previous versions (at least in 1.4.4) allows partial keyword search and was much more friendly.
fields.summary: Partial terms do not return any results when searching for usernames, full names or emails in "manage users"

fields.description: Due to username change, we deactivated one user that belongs to confluence-administrators page.  However, when one presses "Contact Administrators" link at the bottom of every page, both the new user and the deactivated user show up in the list of administrators.
fields.summary: Deactivated administrator user show up in "Contact Administrators" link
